title: Display all prices in Indian Rupees (INR) across the app

requirements.text: Update all currency display and formatting across the storefront and portals so every monetary amount is shown in Indian Rupees (INR) using the ₹ symbol (not $), including product cards, product details, cart, checkout, customer order history, and admin/nursery management views that display prices.

quotes: all the currencies are Indian Rupees

acceptanceCriteria: Product prices in ProductCard (frontend/src/components/store/ProductCard.tsx) render in INR (₹) and not in USD ($).
Product price in ProductDetailsPage (frontend/src/pages/ProductDetailsPage.tsx) renders in INR (₹) and not in USD ($).
CartPage (frontend/src/pages/CartPage.tsx) line-item prices, subtotals, and totals render in INR (₹) and not in USD ($).
CheckoutPage (frontend/src/pages/CheckoutPage.tsx) item prices and total render in INR (₹) and not in USD ($).
MyOrdersPage (frontend/src/pages/MyOrdersPage.tsx) per-item prices and order totals render in INR (₹) and not in USD ($).

Admin/Nursery views that show prices (e.g., products lists in admin nursery management, and any other admin/nursery product lists/forms that display a computed currency string) render in INR (₹) and not in USD ($).

requirements.text: Centralize money formatting into a shared frontend utility (e.g., a helper that formats a cents/paise integer as INR using an English locale) and refactor existing UI code to use it instead of manual string interpolation like "${...toFixed(2)}".

quotes: all the currencies are Indian Rupees

acceptanceCriteria: A single reusable formatting helper is introduced and used wherever currency is displayed, rather than duplicating "$" string templates in components/pages.
Formatting uses INR with the ₹ symbol and shows two decimal places consistently for integer cents/paise inputs.
No user-facing currency strings in the app UI contain the "$" symbol after the change.

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI components).
Do not change files listed under frontend.immutablePaths in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
Backend architecture must remain single-actor; no new backend services.
nonGoals: Changing the underlying stored price units (priceCents) in the backend.
Adding multi-currency selection or a currency switcher.
Integrating external payment processors or exchange-rate APIs.
